text: The Putra Mosque is the main mosque of Putrajaya, Malaysia. Construction began in 1997 and finished in 1999. It is on Putra Square next to Putrajaya Lake. The mosque has a pink dome made from rose-tinted granite. It has three main areas: the prayer hall, the courtyard, and learning facilities. It can hold 15,000 worshippers at once. On 25 June 1999, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad visited the mosque for prayers. ==Photo Gallery== Masjid Putra - Main Prayer Hall.jpg|The main prayer hall. Putra Mosque Spire.jpg|The dome, made of pink and white granite tiles, is a unique feature. ==References== Category:1999 establishments in Asia Category:1990s establishments in Malaysia Category:Buildings and structures in Malaysia Category:Mosques in Asia Category:Putrajaya
title: Putra Mosque
